intro: Astronia elaterinervis, commonly known as the narrow-veined astronia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves with prominent, parallel veins. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Astronia elaterinervis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
